alert.note: Alert for Franklin; Jackson; Perry; Williamson (Illinois) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Paducah (Southern Illinois and Indiana, Southeastern Missouri and Western Kentucky)
info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued July 17 at 9:19AM CDT by NWS Paducah
info.description: ...Strong thunderstorms will impact portions of southeastern Perry, northwestern Williamson, northern Jackson and southwestern Franklin Counties through 945 AM CDT... At 918 AM CDT, Doppler radar was tracking strong thunderstorms along a line extending from near Du Quoin to 7 miles west of Murphysboro. Movement was east at 35 mph. HAZARD...Winds in excess of 40 mph. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Strong thunderstorms will be near... Du Quoin and Elkville around 925 AM CDT. Carbondale and Royalton around 935 AM CDT. Other locations in the path of these storms include Christopher, Zeigler, De Soto, Herrin, Benton, Carterville, Cambria, Hurst and West City. This includes Interstate 57 in Illinois between Mile Markers 67 and 71. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.00 IN MAX WIND GUST...40 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. Torrential rainfall is also occurring with these storms and may lead to localized flooding. Do not drive your vehicle through flooded roadways.
